moves.1. e4: I move up my king's pawn to free his bishop and the queen...
moves.1... c5: ...my opponent opens with his queenside bishop's pawn to free his queen from the shorter diagonal, and possibly to spring a surprise...
moves.2. d4: ...and I pressure it with my queen's pawn, also to free her bishop, and to give her more room to manoeuvre...
moves.2... b6: ...but instead of capturing, he covers with his queenside knight's pawn, possibly to fianchetto his bishop...
moves.4. Be3: ...and I pressure with my queenside bishop...
moves.4... e5: ...then he moves forward his king's pawn to free his bishop and the queen from another side...
moves.5. Qd5: ...so I attack both pawns on the 5th rank, along with his rook...
moves.5... Nc6: ...and he covers his king's pawn with his knight...
moves.6. Bc4: ...so I give my queen some support from my kingside bishop...
moves.6... Nf6: ...and as he moves his knight instead of his queen...
